definition: a group united by common traits or interests : category

a specific or recognized variety                                      
             
             what kind of car do you drive

a doubtful or barely admissible member of a category                                      
             
             a kind of gray

fundamental nature or quality : essence                                      
             
             a difference in degree but not in kind

goods or commodities as distinguished from money                                      
             
             payment in kind

the equivalent of what has been offered or received                                      
             
             promised to return the favor in kind
nature
family, lineage
manner

many                                      
             
             likes all kinds of sports

plenty of                                      
             
             has all kinds of time

of a sympathetic or helpful nature                                      
             
             was helped by a kind neighbor

of a forbearing nature : gentle                                      
             
             kind treatment of animals

arising from or characterized by sympathy or forbearance                                      
             
             a kind act

of a kind to give pleasure or relief                                      
             
             cooled by a kind breeze
affectionate, loving
a group of people or things that belong together or have some shared quality : a particular type or variety of person or thing
having or showing a gentle nature and a desire to help others : wanting and liking to do good things and to bring happiness to others
—used to say that something does not cause harm, is not harsh or unpleasant, etc.                  —usually + to
—used to make a formal request

a group of persons or things that belong together or have something in common                                      
             
             All kinds of people came.

wanting or liking to do good and to bring happiness to others : considerate                                      
             
             a kind woman

showing or growing out of gentleness or goodness of heart                                      
             
             a kind act

a particular type, category, or class                                      
             
             properties of like kind

an unconverted form                                      
             
             a partition of property in kind

the equivalent in value                                      
             
             repay a loan in kind

payment in kind

definition: a type of person or thing
all the people who are similar to a person, for example because they come from the same social class
in: kind of: What kind of person is she?
different kinds of: Many people like to try lots of different kinds of food.
of some kind: We’ve all had disappointments of some kind.
of any kind: There are no notes of any kind in the text.
all kinds of: Francis taught me all kinds of stuff.
Terry was more comfortable with his own kind.
be the kind
the biggest/best etc of its/their kind
in kind
kind of
someone’s kind of
of a kind
one of a kind
something of the kind
two/three etc of a kind

definition: generous, helpful, and thinking about other people's feelings:
not causing harm or damage:
a group with similar characteristics, or a particular type:
generous, helpful, and caring about other people:
used to describe a payment that is given in the form of goods or services and not in the form of money:
